If you have osteoporosis or are at risk, be proactive to prevent fractures.
{{BULLET}}Bone density testing can alert you to potential fracture risk.   
{{BULLET}} Call your PCP and make an appointment today for a safer tomorrow.

For many women, mammograms are the best way to detect breast cancer early.  
{{BULLET}}  Early detection improves treatment outcomes and survival rates. 
{{BULLET}} Family history increases your risk.
{{BULLET}} Find a provider in-network and we will cover the cost.
Prostate cancer caught early is treatable and curable.  Visit your PCP for this easy, painless exam and peace of mind.  Make your appointment today.

Cervical cancer screening detects cell changes of the cervix.  
{{BULLET}} Early detection is key to preventing cancer progression and saving lives. 
{{BULLET}} Find an in-network provider and schedule today.
{{BULLET}} We will cover the cost.

Detecting cancer early saves lives! 
{{BULLET}} A colonoscopy is an important preventive health screening to catch cancer early and treat it.  
{{BULLET}} Personal or family history, lifestyle factors and inflammoatory bowel disease increase your risk. 
{{BULLET}} Find a provider in-network and schedule today.
{{BULLET}} We will cover the cost.

Skin cancer screening is the best way to detect cancer at an early stage. 
{{BULLET}} Early detection means the chance of a cure is high.
{{BULLET}}Family history, eye color, skin tone and hair color can increase your risk.
{{BULLET}} Find a dermatologist and schedule your appointment today.

Breathe easier knowing your lungs are performing their best.  
{{BULLET}} Spirometry is used to diagnose asthma and other lung conditions that affect breathing.  
{{BULLET}} Call your PCP and make your appointment today.
Being diabetic means your vision is at risk.  Regular eye exams with an opthamologist (aka Eye Doctor) is important to maintaining your vision.  Find a provider and book your appointment today.

Did you know being diabetic increases the risk for Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD)?
{{BULLET}} CKDh increases your risk for heart disease and stroke.
{{BULLET}} Stay on top of your health.
{{BULLET}} Call your PCP to get screened with a simple urine test.
Managing your diabetes means having your A1C checked regularly.  Be proactive to avoid complications - schedule your next AIc Test today.
